title: 2026 Winter Olympics open amid geopolitical and climate tensions
subhed: The Winter Olympics, which begin on Friday, promise a spectacle of athletic achievement, emotion and entertainment broadcast worldwide. Yet its organizers must now prove that their dispersed venue model is viable.

title: French government expects resistance from Jack Lang after summons to explain Epstein ties
Jean-Luc Mélenchon courts small business owners
France warns of possible 'IS resurgence' in Syria, where 'French citizens' security is also at stake'
subhed: According to Paris, the Syrian authorities' agreement with Kurdish forces challenges the structure of the fight against the jihadist group in Syria and Iraq. On Thursday, France's foreign minister traveled to Damascus, Baghdad and Erbil.
byline: By Stéphanie Le Bars (Damascus, Baghdad, Erbil, special correspondent)

title: French judge and her mother freed after a cryptocurrency-linked abduction
subhed: The two women were kidnapped on Wednesday night. The judge's partner is an active investor in the cryptocurrency sector.
byline: By Antoine Albertini and Damien Leloup

title: Six Nations: France holds promises with decisive victory against Ireland
subhed: The French, buoyed by the return of Antoine Dupont, convincingly defeated the Irish at the Stade de France (36-14). They have launched their title defense with panache.

title: UK inquiry further incriminates French rescue services in 2021 Channel shipwreck
subhed: The findings of a British public inquiry reveal that French rescue services on November 24, 2021, instructed an oil tanker to continue its course, even though it was likely the ship had located the distressed dinghy in which 31 people perished.

title: Secondhand market booms, challenging luxury industry

Jeffrey Epstein's business ties with banker Ariane de Rothschild revealed
subhed: The latest release of the Epstein files by the US Department of Justice has confirmed the extremely close relationship between the French-German head of the Edmond de Rothschild group and the convicted sex offender. From 2013 until his death in 2019, he acted as an unofficial adviser to the Switzerland-based bank.

title: 'Canada, better the 28th EU member than the 51st US state'
subhed: The Canadian prime minister has called for an alliance of middle powers to stand up to the world's great powers. This is a compelling idea, and one that Europe has been pursuing for 60 years, writes Le Monde columnist Pascal Riché.

title: Democracy is fading in Africa as the world looks away
subhed: While global powers covet Africa's natural resources, they have paid little attention to the wave of coups that have swept the continent in recent years.

title: The US versus human rights
'To revive a strong integration policy, it must become a government priority, separate from the issue of immigration'
'The Kurds had Western support, especially from the US. That support has now been withdrawn'
